title: The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Is Almost Half Off For The Holidays
description: You can bring the magic of Amazon's Fire TV platform to your TV for a lot less with this holiday deal.
author: Ayomide Sadiq
excerpt: You can bring the magic of Amazon's Fire TV platform to your TV for a lot less with this holiday deal.
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. With the holidays around the corner, the need to gift people gets more and more intense, and if you're looking to throw tech gifts at your loved ones (or get new gadgets to enjoy on your own), you've got to be able to sniff out the very best of deals. That's part of what we're here for. The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K brings 4K streaming and content straight to any screen around you, whether it is your computer monitor or your TV. And the very best part is that the streaming device is enjoying nearly 50% off for the holidays, giving you the perfect time to jump in and grab it. The Amazon Fire TV Stick Drops From $49.99 To An Inexpensive $27.99 Price Tag Image: Amazon On a regular day, the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K will set you back by $49.99. For that price, it brings a whole lot to the table. Whether you have a “dumb” TV, a smart TV that doesn't have the functionality that you're craving, or you want to add a much more fleshed-out content streaming experience to your computer, Amazon's Fire TV Stick 4K will get the job done for you, in UHD too. However, while it can hardly be thought of as “too expensive”, its price is just high enough that you might hesitate to pull the trigger. The good thing is that with these holiday sales, you don't need to think too much about whether the Fire TV Stick will make a good gift for you or someone else. Image: Amazon Amazon is discounting the Fire TV Stick 4K pretty aggressively, hitting that $49.99 price tag with a 44% discount—nearly half of its cost—to bring it down to just $27.99. With $22 off the original price, getting the Fire TV Stick 4K becomes a lot less complicated a decision to make. What Hardware And Software Features Does The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Boast Of? If you're a bit of a smart tech buyer, you might want to know exactly what the Amazon Fire TV Stick brings to the table before you decide to spend your money on it. That's a good decision, so let's talk about it. On the hardware front, there's not too much to talk about. Inside this little stick is a quad-core processor with a clock speed of 1.7GHz and a GPU capable of displaying your favorite content in 4K Ultra HD, with support for Dolby Vision and HDR10+ standards. You also get Wi-Fi 6 compatibility, which should make it more likely for you to enjoy smooth streaming all the time. Image: Amazon It might also just seem like a relatively simple device that runs Fire TV, but it has a lot of tricks up its sleeve. For instance, apart from a large collection of supported apps, you get the magic of Alexa built-in, which can help you conversationally find new content to watch. You can also control your smart home devices right from the TV. The Fire TV Stick 4K also supports Xbox Cloud Gaming, letting you play AAA titles on your Fire TV Stick. Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes. Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

With the holidays around the corner, the need to gift people gets more and more intense, and if you're looking to throw tech gifts at your loved ones (or get new gadgets to enjoy on your own), you've got to be able to sniff out the very best of deals. That's part of what we're here for.

The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K brings 4K streaming and content straight to any screen around you, whether it is your computer monitor or your TV. And the very best part is that the streaming device is enjoying nearly 50% off for the holidays, giving you the perfect time to jump in and grab it.

The Amazon Fire TV Stick Drops From $49.99 To An Inexpensive $27.99 Price Tag

On a regular day, the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K will set you back by $49.99. For that price, it brings a whole lot to the table. Whether you have a “dumb” TV, a smart TV that doesn't have the functionality that you're craving, or you want to add a much more fleshed-out content streaming experience to your computer, Amazon's Fire TV Stick 4K will get the job done for you, in UHD too.

However, while it can hardly be thought of as “too expensive”, its price is just high enough that you might hesitate to pull the trigger. The good thing is that with these holiday sales, you don't need to think too much about whether the Fire TV Stick will make a good gift for you or someone else.

Amazon is discounting the Fire TV Stick 4K pretty aggressively, hitting that $49.99 price tag with a 44% discount—nearly half of its cost—to bring it down to just $27.99. With $22 off the original price, getting the Fire TV Stick 4K becomes a lot less complicated a decision to make.

What Hardware And Software Features Does The Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Boast Of?

If you're a bit of a smart tech buyer, you might want to know exactly what the Amazon Fire TV Stick brings to the table before you decide to spend your money on it. That's a good decision, so let's talk about it.

On the hardware front, there's not too much to talk about. Inside this little stick is a quad-core processor with a clock speed of 1.7GHz and a GPU capable of displaying your favorite content in 4K Ultra HD, with support for Dolby Vision and HDR10+ standards. You also get Wi-Fi 6 compatibility, which should make it more likely for you to enjoy smooth streaming all the time.

It might also just seem like a relatively simple device that runs Fire TV, but it has a lot of tricks up its sleeve. For instance, apart from a large collection of supported apps, you get the magic of Alexa built-in, which can help you conversationally find new content to watch. You can also control your smart home devices right from the TV. The Fire TV Stick 4K also supports Xbox Cloud Gaming, letting you play AAA titles on your Fire TV Stick.

Through Tecno, Gionee, Vivo, Google, and now Samsung, Ayomide has always been an Android enthusiast. His current partner in crime is a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra. You can find him playing Candy Crush or Call of Duty: Mobile, watching movies, and he is a big fan of trivia and quizzes.
